This is a modifier. Returns a list of webcams according to the listed continents. Multiple continents must be separated by comma. Required: at least one {continent}.

required_parameters.name: continent
required_parameters.description: Possible values for {continent} are: "AF" (Africa), "AN" (Antarctica), "AS" (Asia), "EU" (Europe), "NA" (North America), "OC" (Oceania), or "SA" (South America)

optional_parameters.name: lang
optional_parameters.description: Localize the results to this language, if available. Default: "en".

optional_parameters.name: show
optional_parameters.description: Content to be listed in the response. Possible values are: "webcams", "categories", "continents", "countries", "regions", "properties". Default is "webcams".

api_list.api_description: This is a modifier. Returns a list of the webcams in the bounding box given by north-east ({ne_lat},{ne_lng}) and south-west ({sw_lat},{sw_lng}) coordinates. Required: {ne_lat},{ne_lng},{sw_lat},{sw_lng}.

required_parameters.name: ne_lat
required_parameters.description: North-east WGS84 latitude of the bounding box.

required_parameters.name: sw_lng
required_parameters.description: South-west WGS84 longitude of the bounding box.

required_parameters.name: sw_lat
required_parameters.description: South-west WGS84 latitude of the bounding box.

required_parameters.name: ne_lng
required_parameters.description: North-east WGS84 longitude of the bounding box.

optional_parameters.name: lang
optional_parameters.description: Localize the results to this language, if available. Default: "en".

optional_parameters.name: show
optional_parameters.description: Content to be listed in the response. Possible values are: "webcams", "categories", "continents", "countries", "regions", "properties". Default is "webcams".

api_list.api_description: This is a modifier. Returns the list of webcams ordered by {order}. The optional sorting direction is given by {sort}. Required {order}.

required_parameters.name: sort
required_parameters.description: Possible values are: "asc" (ascending), or "desc" (descending).

required_parameters.name: order
required_parameters.description: Possible values are: "popularity" (default order: "desc"), "hotness" (default order: "desc"), "new" (default order: "desc"), "recent" (default order: "desc"), "random" (default order: "asc"), or "distance" (default order: "asc", only available if the modifier "nearby" has been applied).

optional_parameters.name: lang
optional_parameters.description: Localize the results to this language, if available. Default: "en".

optional_parameters.name: show
optional_parameters.description: Content to be listed in the response. Possible values are: "webcams", "categories", "continents", "countries", "regions", "properties". Default is "webcams".

api_list.api_description: A get request is used to retrieve a specific object from the TripIt API given its TripIt object ID. Since get requests do not change data they are all made via an HTTP GET request for a URL that takes the following form:

required_parameters.name: object_type
required_parameters.description: is one of the following strings:  air activity car cruise directions lodging map note points_program profile rail restaurant transport trip weather

required_parameters.name: tripit_object_id
required_parameters.description: is the object ID of the TripIt object being requested.

api_list.api_description: A list request is used to retrieve multiple objects given an object type and set of filter parameters. Since list requests do not change data they are all made via an HTTP GET request for a URL that takes the following form:

required_parameters.name: object_type
required_parameters.description: is one of the following strings:  trip object points_program

required_parameters.name: filter_parameter
required_parameters.description: Valid values for <filter parameter> and <filter value> depend on the <object type>.  See  http://tripit.github.io/api/doc/v1/index.html#resource_section for a table of valid combinations.

required_parameters.name: filter_value
required_parameters.description: Valid values for <filter parameter> and <filter value> depend on the <object type>.  See  http://tripit.github.io/api/doc/v1/index.html#resource_section for a table of valid combinations.

api_list.api_description: A delete request is used to delete existing objects

required_parameters.name: object_type
required_parameters.description: is one of the following strings:  air activity car cruise directions lodging map note rail restaurant segment transport trip

required_parameters.name: tripit_object_id
required_parameters.description: is the object ID of the TripIt object being requested.

GET /api/[culture]/collection gives the full collection with brief information about each work. This results are split up in result pages. By using the p and ps parameters you can fetch more results. All of the other parameters are identical to the search page on the Rijksmuseum website. You can use that to find out what's the best query to use

required_parameters.name: q
required_parameters.description: The search terms that need to occur in one of the fields of the artwork data

required_parameters.name: culture
required_parameters.description: nl / en		The language to search in (and of the results)

api_list.api_description: This is prototype endpoint for using Giphy as a translation engine for a GIF dialect. The translate API draws on search, but uses the Giphy "special sauce" to handle translating from one vocabulary to another. In this case, words and phrases to GIFs. Use a plus or url encode for phrases.

required_parameters.name: s
required_parameters.description: term or phrase to translate into a GIF

optional_parameters.name: rating
optional_parameters.description: limit results to those rated (y,g, pg, pg-13 or r).

api_list.api_description: Fetch GIFs currently trending online. The data returned mirrors that used to create The Hot 100 list of GIFs on Giphy. Returns 25 results by default.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: limits the number of results returned. By default returns 25 results.

optional_parameters.name: rating
optional_parameters.description: limit results to those rated (y,g, pg, pg-13 or r).

api_list.api_description: Get the latest stickers trending on Giphy with this endpoint.

required_parameters.name: s
required_parameters.description: term or phrase to translate into a GIF

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: number of results to return, maximum 100. Default: 25

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: results offset, defaults to 0

optional_parameters.name: fmt
optional_parameters.description: return results in html or json format.

optional_parameters.name: rating
optional_parameters.description: limit results to those rated (y,g, pg, pg-13 or r).

api_list.api_description:
**Advanced Phone Number Information**

*retrieves valuable technical data about a phone number*

- validity

- approximate location

- timezone

- carrier

- line type

- ported status

- carrier

- robocall/spam score

- much more

**Basic Phone Number Validation**

- determine if a phone number is in a valid format 

- determine if a phone number is impossible for a particular region

- properly format the number for various scenarios like international or local dialing

- attempts to determine line type

- determines country and country code

The form-check-user API validates user, and returns the user's details.

required_parameters.name: user
required_parameters.description: REQUIRED: The ID of the user. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required if the bot is private.

optional_parameters.name: application
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

optional_parameters.name: password
optional_parameters.description: REQUIRED: The password of the user. A token can also be used.

optional_parameters.name: token
optional_parameters.description: REQUIRED: The token of the user. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

api_list.api_description: The form-check-instance API validates that a bot ID or name exists, and returns the bot's details.

required_parameters.name: password
required_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The password of the user. A token can also be used.

optional_parameters.name: id
optional_parameters.description: REQUIRED: The ID of the bot to validate. The bot's name can also be used, but the ID is better as it is guaranteed to be unique.

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description: REQUIRED: The nameof the bot to validate. The bot's ID can also be used.

optional_parameters.name: application
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

optional_parameters.name: user
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The ID of the user. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required if the bot is private.

optional_parameters.name: token
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The token of the user. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

api_list.api_description: The form-chat API receives a chat message and returns the chat bot's reply as an XML document.

required_parameters.name: instance
required_parameters.description: REQUIRED: The ID of the bot to chat with. The bot's name can also be used, but the ID is better as it is guaranteed to be unique.

optional_parameters.name: application
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

optional_parameters.name: user
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The ID of the user who is sending the message. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required if the bot is private. The user/password are only required on the first message.

optional_parameters.name: password
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The password of the user who is sending the message. A token can also be used.

optional_parameters.name: token
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The token of the user who is sending the message. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

optional_parameters.name: conversation
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The conversation ID for the current conversation. This must not be passed on the first message, but will be returned by the response, and should be used for all subsequent messages in the conversation.

optional_parameters.name: message
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The chat message to send to the bot. The message can be omitted if you wish the bot to start the conversation (if the bot has a greeting set). The message must be encoded in the URI.

optional_parameters.name: emote
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: A emotion to tag the message with. This is one of LOVE, LIKE, DISLIKE, HATE, RAGE, ANGER, CALM, SERENE, ECSTATIC, HAPPY, SAD, CRYING, PANIC, AFRAID, CONFIDENT, COURAGEOUS, SURPRISE, BORED, LAUGHTER, SERIOUS.

optional_parameters.name: correction
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that defines the chat message is a correction to the bot's last answer.

optional_parameters.name: offensive
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that defines the bot's last answer as offensive. The message will be flagged for the bot's administrator to review.

optional_parameters.name: disconnect
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that defines the end of the conversation.

optional_parameters.name: includeQuestion
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that indicates the question should be included in the response.

This method allows you to get the quality score for your photo. This service doesn't measure how cool or beautiful a person or an object on a photo may look. It cares only about technical parts like brightness, contrast, noise and so on. The service is not dedicated for scoring historical photos, illustrations or 3D visualizations.

optional_parameters.name: content
optional_parameters.description: You can also send an actual image files for scoring.

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description: Image URL to perform scoring on.

api_list.api_description: By sending an image to this method you can get a list of suggested keywords. You may specify a number of returned words or a threshold of its minimum score. Just provide num_keywords or threshold parameter to this method.

optional_parameters.name: content
optional_parameters.description: You can also send an actual image files for auto-tagging.

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description: Image URL to perform auto-tagging on.

api_list.api_description: The main difference between Stock photo scoring and this model is in the training dataset. User-Generated Photo Scoring is a model trained on a 347 000 of user photos from Instagram. Estimation parameters for this model were prepared by a group of 10 professional photographers. Scoring methods are based on five classes: very bad (0-20), bad (20-40), normal (40-60), good (60-80) and excellent (80-100).  This model is designed to evaluate user photos taken both by a professional camera and by a camera of a smartphone. It doesn't estimate the plot and do not measure how cool or beautiful a person or an object on a photo may look. It cares only about technical parts like brightness, contrast, noise and so on. The service is not dedicated for scoring historical photos, illustrations or 3D visualizations.

optional_parameters.name: content
optional_parameters.description: You can also send an actual image files for scoring.

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description: Image URL to perform scoring on.

Please provide Values from the below list as per your need. 
 'QUOTED '=> Quoted by the client but not confirmed
'CONFIRMED' => Confirmed by Driver (assigned to the driver)

'COMPLETED'  => Completed trip
'CANCELLED' => Canceled by either party
 'REQUESTED' => Requested to driver (new rides)
